ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Irritability During the preceding week, the subject, has had a tendecy to lose his/her temper, to shout or act violently in reaction to stimuli that do not normally produce such reactions. IF YES
Irritability During the preceding week, the subject, has had a tendecy to lose his/her temper, to shout or act violently in reaction to stimuli that do not normally produce such reactions.
Patience/Impatience Capacity to wait. In the last few days, the subject has shown patience (e.g., standing in line at a checkout) IF YES
Notes: 0=Yes, reasonably; 1=No, but was able to tolerate some waiting; 2=No. Does not tolerate waiting. Impatient; 3=No. Impatience was a great distress; -1 Yes, Very much (RI)

ElementDescription: Patience/Impatience Capacity to wait. In the last few days, the subject has shown patience (e.g., standing in line at a checkout)
Time for making decisions (e.g., buying habits in department stores) In the preceding week. IF YES
Notes: 0=Has been acting normally; 1=Made quick but appropriate decisions; 2=Made decisions hastily without ; 3=Same as preceding item, but with regrettable consequences; -1=Has not been able to acr w/o taking time (RI)

ElementDescription: Time for making decisions (e.g., buying habits in department stores) In the preceding week.
Capacity to pursue an activity (occupation or main activity, e.g., housewife) During the last few days, the subject: IF YES
Notes: 0=Normal; 1=Has been prone to distraction; 2=Has let him/herself be distracted; 3=Has been incapable; -1=Has had no difficulty in holding to his/her activities (RI)

ElementDescription: Capacity to pursue an activity (occupation or main activity, e.g., housewife) During the last few days, the subject:
Aggresiveness During the last few days, the subject: IF YES
Notes: 0=Normal; 1=Has been prone to acting aggresively; 2=Has had aggressive reactions; 3=Has been permanently aggressive; -1=Has clearly lacked aggresiveness (RI)

ElementDescription: Aggresiveness During the last few days, the subject:
Control of responses During the last few days , the subject: IF YES
Notes: 0=Normal; 1=There has been some degree of control; 2=There have been persisting attempts to control; 3=Incapable of controlling repsonse; -1=Has shown a tendecy to excessively control (RI)

ElementDescription: Control of responses During the last few days , the subject:
Capacity to delay IF YES
Notes: 0=Normal; 1=The subject is capable of making long-term plans; 2=Choosing activities that provide immediate satisfaction; 3=No long-term schemes; -1=The subject's strategy systematically favors long-term plans (RI)

ElementDescription: IRS Total Score
Number of items rated Reduced-I (RI)
MetaTrial Visit ID
Notes: System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files

ElementDescription: Week in level/study
